item.title: Samba (smb)
item.description: Overview Samba is a free software re-implementation of the SMB/CIFS networking protocol. Samba provides file and print services for various Microsoft Windows clients and can integrate with a Microsoft Windows Server domain, either as a Domain Controller (DC) or as a domain member. As of version 4, it supports Active Directory and Microsoft Windows NT domains. Configuration On Ubuntu configuration file is located in /etc/samba/smb.conf. You need root privileges to edit it.
